page.title: 03Stetchworth(continued)
page.content: Stetchworth is mainly residential now although there used to be quite a lot of industry connected with farming and horse breeding. All that is left apart from farms and studs is the woodyard at the top of Teakettle Lane.This used to supply all the wood used for farm buildings but nowadays it only sells firewood to local residents. In February 1985, a farrier set up business in the closed down Co-op shop in the High Street.He serves the local studs. Over half the parents of children at Stetchworth School travel outside the area to work. The rest either work at home or are unemployed.We think that, apart from the old aged pensioners, this is true of most of the people who live in the area.
